data.title: American Jazz Legend Bob James Lays it Down Live on NPR's Tiny Desk Concert
data.meta_description: Discover jazz legend Bob James and his iconic tunes, sampled by DJ Jazzy Jeff, Cee-Lo, and more.
data.text:
You may think you don’t know a musician by the name of Bob James, but you definitely do. The American jazz keyboardist, arranger, and record producer has been shaping the music scene since the 1970s. Artists like DJ Jazzy Jeff & The Fresh Prince, and Cee-Lo have borrowed from James in some of the most memorable tracks, immortalizing his tunes “Westchester Lady,” “Nautilus,” and “Angela.”

James initially wasn’t a fan of his songs being sampled. However, seeing the profound impact on music lovers worldwide and receiving due recognition, he grew to appreciate this modern twist on his work. Today, Bob James is still a force in the music industry, evidenced by his Grammy-nominated 2024 album, Jazz Hands.

Jazz Hands marks a significant moment in James’s career, featuring a full-circle collaboration with DJ Jazzy Jeff and Talib Kweli. This ensemble joined the piano master at NPR’s Tiny Desk Concert for a remarkable rendition of “Nautilus,” one of James’s most sampled tracks. The performance highlights James’s timeless influence and showcases how contemporary artists continue to draw inspiration from his pioneering work.

Bob James’s enduring legacy in jazz and popular music is undeniable. His ability to adapt and thrive in an ever-evolving industry while staying true to his roots is a testament to his talent and dedication. From jazz aficionados to hip-hop enthusiasts, everyone finds something to love in his extensive catalog.

So, if you’re ready to experience how it’s done by none other than Bob James, hit play and enjoy his unforgettable performance at NPR’s Tiny Desk Concert. Dive into the rich, soulful world of a musician you didn’t know you knew and let the timeless sounds of Bob James sweep you away.
